If the function \\( z(t) = e^{i\\omega t}z_0 \\) is allowed to evolve naturally under its given differential equation, will the transformed function \\( T(z) \\) for a fixed time T be the same if no transformations are applied?

This effectively changes how the function accumulates phase and magnitude over time, resulting in a transformed function that is not simply \\( z(t) \\) at time T but an accumulation of the function's history multiplied by an exponential weight.
